entry_headline: MUSICWEEK: KOBALT: 'THE MUSIC INDUSTRY IS SUFFERING FROM A SLOW DEATH'
entry_abstract: Kobalt CEO Willard Ahdritz believes the music industry is killing itself. He has a vision for the future, one he says will benefit every artist, writer and rights-holder in existence. But it will cause music biz heavyweights short-term pain - something he says they’re desperate to avoid

entry_headline: MUSIC WEEK KOBALT FEATURE: FOR YOUR INFORMATION
entry_abstract: In a major Music Week story Kobalt’s mission is outlined by Founder/CEO Willard Ahdritz, who explains how the company's "hard core indie, backed by technology" philosophy is keenly centered on principles of “clients first” and increasing the “pie for everyone.”

entry_headline: WILLARD AHDRITZ TO DELIVER MIDEM MUSIC SUMMIT KEYNOTE
entry_abstract: The Founder/CEO of Kobalt Music Group will speak at Midem on the opportunities and challenges facing music publishers and business models that better service the needs of songwriters and rights-holders in today's increasingly complex landscape of online music consumption.

entry_abstract: Ben Godding Appointed as KLS Australia Manager of Label Services

entry_headline: BREAKING NEWS: BILLBOARD REPORTS KOBALT TO SPEND 100 M USD IN THE COMING YEAR IN MUSIC ROYALTIES
entry_abstract: Billboard's Ed Christman reports Kobalt is in talks to invest in and acquire rights in royalty streams generated by some of the world’s most popular artists and songwriters.

entry_headline: BILLBOARD COVER STORY REVEALS KOBALT PUBLISHING BUSINESS REVOLUTION
entry_abstract: Billboard recently featured Kobalt CEO and Founder Willard Ahdritz on its cover plus wrote seven-page story about how Ahdritz, “leads a publishing business revolution.” Reporter Ed Christman writes about how the company is turning publishing upside down and explores, “Why Willard Ahdritz’s strategies are working, and why his Kobalt Music is the future.”

entry_headline: DIGITAL MUSIC NEWS REPORTS KOBALT GOTYE SIGNING
entry_abstract: Digital Music News reported in February that Kobalt signed Gotye to a worldwide publishing deal, which excludes Australia and New Zealand.

entry_headline: KOBALT'S AWAL PURCHASE AND EXPANSION COVERED BY GLOBAL INDUSTRY, TRADE PRESS
entry_abstract: Check out coverage from around the world.

entry_headline: Billboard Feature: Publisher's Rollout Of Weekly Balance Updates Ups The Ante On Client Services
entry_abstract: Billboard reports Kobalt is providing clients with weekly royalty balances, as well as the ability to be paid immediately in the form of an advance on expected royalties.

entry_headline: KOBALT MUSIC GROUP WINS INDEPENDENT MUSIC PUBLISHER OF THE YEAR
entry_abstract: At the 2009 Music Awards held recently in London Kobalt took top honors. Positioned as an "alternative" to the traditional music publisher, Kobalt's client base has nearly tripled in three years and attracted top global artists, songwriters, producers, music publishers including Gwen Stefani, Tony Kanal of No Doubt, Ryan Tedder, Dr. Luke, Moby, Desmond Child, and Max Martin, among hundreds of others.

entry_headline: THE BILLBOARD Q&A: WILLARD AHDRITZ
entry_abstract: "We have the track record that this is the model for the future. Our clients typically experience up to 25% more revenue on average when they come to us from a traditional publishing model." - Willard Ahdritz, CEO and Founder of Kobalt Music Group

entry_headline: KOBALT PERFORMS HEROICS IN THE INDIE SECTOR
entry_abstract: Music Week -- Kobalt has only been in existence since 2000, but such has been its rapid rise that last year it took control of more than a quarter of the UK's independent publishing sector.
